metadata.title: CVE-2017-3291 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Packaging). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.53 andearlier, 5.6.34 and earlier and 5.7.16 and earlier. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows high privileged attacker with logon to theinfrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than theattacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeoverof MySQL Server. CVSS v3.0 Base Score 6.3 (Confidentiality, Integrity andAvailability impacts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3291` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.54-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
